alert.note: Alert for Prince George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 3:28PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Prince George, central Sussex and eastern Dinwiddie Counties and the City of Petersburg through 415 PM EDT... At 328 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dinwiddie, moving east southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Dinwiddie, Stony Creek, Dewitt, Sutherland, Carson, Burgess, Addison, Reams, New Bohemia, Petersburg Airport, Richard Bland College, Templeton, Prince George Golf and Butterworth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
